name: Clumber on the War Path Circular Walk, Clumber Park

ai.summary: Clumber on the War Path Circular Walk is a demanding 28.1 km circuit starting and ending at Clumber Park in the UK. The route traverses a mix of parkland, woodland, and farmland, offering varied scenery and a fair amount of distance and elevation for experienced hikers. Plan for a full day and be prepared for weather and terrain changes along the way.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed surfaces including tarmac and gravel paths, grassy tracks, and woodland trails. Expect gates and stiles, occasional muddy sections, and rolling terrain with variable footing. Some sections may be exposed to wind; overall footing can be uneven.
ai.safety_notes: This is a long, hard hike; plan for 6–8 hours. Start early to ensure daylight. Check park access and any seasonal restrictions at Clumber Park. Bring a map or GPS and know your route. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and carry enough water and high-energy snacks. Be prepared for mud, weather changes, and variable footing; watch for livestock and road crossings; have a plan for turning back if conditions worsen; inform someone of your route and expected return time.
recommended_gear: Backpack with water and high-energy snacks
Map and compass or GPS device
Fully charged phone plus portable power bank
Lightweight first aid kit and blister care items
Emergency whistle and a small headlamp (for delays or late finish)
Extra layer for cold or wet conditions
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October). Daylight and drier conditions are preferable, though summer can be busier; winter hikes are possible but more challenging due to mud and shorter days.

seo.title: Clumber on the War Path Circular Walk – 28.1 km Hard Hike in Clumber Park, UK
